reg:regulation.reg:title: Legislative Precinct Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 223/2015, January 18, 2016]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: grounds means the legislative grounds and Confederation Garden Park;
vehicle has the same meaning as in the Motor Vehicle Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limited entry, vehicular traffic and parking

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without prior authorization of the Speaker, a person must not enter or remain in or on any part of the grounds where a notice, sign or information device, posted or erected by or under the authority of the Speaker, indicates that entry is prohibited or is restricted to authorized persons.

Without prior authorization of the Speaker, a person must not drive, operate or park a vehicle in or on the grounds where a notice, sign or information device, posted or erected by or under the authority of the Speaker, indicates that vehicle entry or parking is prohibited or is restricted to authorized persons or vehicles.
A notice, sign or information device posted or erected in or on the Legislative Precinct is presumed to have been erected by or under the authority of the Speaker, unless the contrary is established.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not skateboard, rollerblade or rollerskate in or on the grounds.
A person must not reside, camp or sleep in or on the grounds.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without prior authorization of the Speaker, a person must not

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: erect, construct, attach or post, in or on the grounds, any thing, structure, material or object, or
cause any of these things to be done.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not occupy, maintain or use any thing, structure, material or object that is erected, constructed, attached or posted in contravention of subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not erect, remove, alter or deface any notice, sign or information device in or on the Legislative Precinct, except under the authority of the Speaker.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not be in possession of an animal in or on the grounds without prior authorization of the Speaker unless the animal is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: restrained by a leash not longer than 2 metres, or
confined in a container, enclosure or vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person in possession of an animal in accordance with subsection (1) must ensure that no excrement from that animal is left in or on the grounds.

Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a guide dog or a service dog, as defined in the Guide Dog and Service Dog Act, or to an animal employed by a peace officer in the course of that peace officer's duties.
If a person found contravening section 3, 4, 5 (1) (a) or (b) or (2), 6 or 7 (1) receives notice to cease the contravening activity and to leave the Legislative Precinct, the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must immediately leave the Legislative Precinct together with all personal belongings, and
must cease the activity to which the notice applies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Notice under subsection (1) may be oral or written notice from the Speaker or a person acting under the authority of the Speaker or from a peace officer.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A peace officer may remove from the Legislative Precinct

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who fails to obey a notice under section 8, and
any personal property apparently in the possession of that person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 2 (1) or (2), 3, 5 (1) (a) or (b) or (2), 6 or 7 (1) or (2) is guilty of an offence and is liable to a fine not exceeding $1 000.
A person who contravenes 8 (1) (a) or (b) is guilty of an offence and is liable to a fine not exceeding $2 000.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Legislative Assembly Management Committee Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 258, section 8]
